body.name: Contours MaxLite Deluxe Lightweight Compact Umbrella Baby Stroller, Toddler Stroller, Infant Stroller, Travel Stroller for Infant and Toddler - Graphite Gray
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 43 mins
features: LIGHTWEIGHT COMPACT DESIGN: Lightweight 14.9 lb. design is sturdy, compact and easy to take with you

ADJUSTABLE FEATURES: 5-point height-adjustable safety harness with padded strap covers for a secure, comfy fit. Multi-position adjustable seat back with a one-hand infinite recline so baby can relax while on the go
TRAVEL FRIENDLY: Travel-friendly umbrella stroller with a compact fold. Sun canopy with UPF 20 protection and a pullout visor for extra coverage

ALL WHEEL SUSPENSION FOR BUMPY TERRAIN: All-wheel suspension and front wheel locks for better handling on bumpy terrain. Engineered to surpass over 131 miles of testing, or more than 5 marathons, for a premium quality ride
UNDERSEAT STORAGE: Underseat storage basket to conveniently stash your necessities
body.description: The compact and lightweight 15 lb. Contours MaxLite Deluxe Umbrella Stroller is perfect for travel, yet it still includes premium features like a comfy, one-hand multi-position reclining seat and a UPF 20 sun canopy with a pull-out visor for extra coverage – must-have features at a wallet-friendly price! All-wheel suspension and front wheel locks provide better handling on bumpy terrain, and the 5-point safety harness with padded covers keeps your little one comfy. An underseat storage basket and parent cupholder keep your items within easy reach, and the premium vegan leather handles give you a comfortable grip. The MaxLite fits a child up to 50 lb. and has been engineered to perform for over 131 miles of testing, or more than 5 marathons, for a premium quality ride.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price.
reviews.reviewText: Stroller works well for the price, folds up really small and does the job. No complaints.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact Baby stroller
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to share my thoughts on the Contours MaxLite Deluxe Lightweight Compact Umbrella Baby Stroller in Graphite Gray. Let me tell you, it's a game-changer for parents on the move!This stroller is seriously lightweight and compact, making it a breeze to take with you wherever you go. Folding and unfolding it is a piece of cake, so you can easily hop in and out of the car or maneuver through crowded spaces. It's perfect for running errands or going on adventures with your little one.The Graphite Gray color gives it a sleek and modern look. Plus, it's got a comfy seat and a canopy to shield your little munchkin from the sun or rain. It's all about keeping your baby happy and protected!Overall, I think the Contours MaxLite Deluxe Lightweight Compact Umbrella Baby Stroller is a top-notch choice for parents. It's practical, stylish, and designed with both infants and toddlers in mind. So, if you're in the market for a new stroller, this one definitely gets my stamp of approval!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Super light weight.. so light that is can fall over… not happy with it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grateful to Own this Umbrella Stroller!
reviews.reviewText: I got this umbrella stroller for my baby so I’d have an alternative to the heavier strollers that have the bassinet pieces, etc. I needed something that also takes up less room in my car too.This was the perfect option and it’s stylish too!!It was easy to assemble for the pieces needing to be put together and it works exactly as intended for an umbrella stroller. I love the colors and the design too. The stroller works with no issues and my baby is comfortable sitting in it. The handlebars are also made well and are comfortable too.The only thing I would like to see with this stroller is the option to have a tray attachment or something. It would make it easy to put my baby’s things (toys, snacks, etc) on when going out and about for the day.Other than that it’s definitely a good buy and no complaints here!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small and portable, but a bit tricky to collapse and turn
reviews.reviewText: We have a fancy, full size baby stroller that we use as our “daily driver, “ but we also always keep this smaller “Umbrella” stroller in the car. Its smaller size makes it ideal for navigating through the small aisles of stores in the mall. It’s also very portable once collapsed -- as long as we don’t overload its under basket with more than the basics, it can be folded down and easily carried by its handle when our toddler feels like getting out and walking.The only downside is that it’s not as comfortable to turn and use as a “big” stroller, and the unlocking mechanism for collapsing it is a little tricky. I always forget how to close it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High quality and easy to handle stroller
reviews.reviewText: This stroller looks and feels deluxe in its construction and safety features. It is very easy to assemble, you simply snap on the four wheels that are secured with a hole in the sturdy metal with an attached silver dowel. I did have to look up how to fold the stroller, there is a plastic mechanism in the back that you can lift up with your foot that slides up smoothly, and a lever on the right that is pushed down to fold it in. There is also a step on the side for easy carrying. The stroller is lightweight and is only 15 lbs, it can hold up to 50 lbs. The stroller hood has a rating of 20 spf, it is deep and provides great coverage for the kiddo. There is also a cup holder that can be snapped onto the left handle. The umbrella is of high quality in all of the pieces, the metal of the structure, the heavy canvas of the seat and hood, and the padding of the straps. It has brakes on all 4 wheels, the front ones can be used to make for a smoother ride on bumpy surfaces. The under-stroller area is deep and can fit a backpack/diaper bag. It does not appear like the designers forgot anything. The ride is smooth and easy to push.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quality construction, but heavier than expected
reviews.reviewText: This is a very nice quality stroller, and it has a lot of extra features that a standard umbrella stroller does not. Those added features also add some weight to it though. It's not like it's super heavy, it's just heavier than a typical umbrella stroller. (15lbs vs 7lbs) I guess it depends what you mean by 'travel'. If you're throwing it in your car, for farmers markets & things, this is great! If you're hoping for air travel, the extra weight makes it less convenient. Again, not terrible, just not 'max-lite'. I think the price is a bit high, compared to comparable models, so maybe not a very good value.
